place.name: SCOLE
place.gazetteerText: SCOLE, or Osmondiston, a village and a parish in Depwade district, Norfolk. The village stands on the river Waveney, 1¾ mile E by S of Diss r. station; and has a head post-office, ‡ of the name of Scole, extensiveflaxworks, and a fair on Easter Tuesday. The parish comprises 821 acres. Real property, £2, 494. Pop., 677. Houses, 147. The property is divided among a few. S. House, S. Lodge, and the Shrubbery are chief residences. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £259.* Patron, Sir E.Kerrison, Bart. The church is ancient but good. Charities, £7. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
